page.title: 13LITTLE MALVERN FARMS
page.content: Farming in the area is dominated by the amalgamation of 6 farms covering 900 acres with their administrative centre at{Wood Farm.}Land use is mainly{grassland}much of it in 5 year leys for 300 milk cows and 400 young cattle. 300 sheep owned by nearby farmers also graze the land. Involved in the amalgamation was large capital expenditure on buildings and a network of roads. Some{hedges were removed}in 1977 but a few are being replanted. The whole dairying operation is{highly {mechanised}with 5 tractors and only 7 employees. Milk is collected in tankers by the Milk Marketing Board. {Markets}for beef cattle are Worcester, Gloucester, Kidderminster and Ledbury. Amalgamation has left some farmhouses empty - these are being converted into ordinary dwellings or, as at{Danemoor {Farm,}into luxury flats.
